**Orcish chain mail** is a type of [body armor](/wiki/Body_armor "Body armor") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*. It is made of [iron](/wiki/Iron "Iron"), and appears as **crude chain mail** when [unidentified](/wiki/Identification "Identification").

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)

- [2 Description](#Description)

- [3 Strategy](#Strategy)

- [4 History](#History)

- [5 Variants](#Variants)

  - [5.1 SLASH'EM](#SLASH.27EM)
  - [5.2 UnNetHack](#UnNetHack)
  - [5.3 dNethack](#dNethack)
  - [5.4 EvilHack](#EvilHack)
  - [5.5 Hack'EM](#Hack.27EM)

- [6 References](#References)

## Generation

[Orcish](/wiki/Orc_\(starting_race\) "Orc (starting race)") characters start the game with knowledge of orcish chain mail's appearance.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1) Orcish characters in roles that start with [chain mail](/wiki/Chain_mail "Chain mail") will receive orcish chain mail instead, though no roles start with chain mail.[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)

In addition to random generation, general [stores](/wiki/Store "Store"), used armor dealerships and antique weapon outlets can sell orcish chain mail.

[Mordor orcs](/wiki/Mordor_orc "Mordor orc") have a 1⁄3 chance of [being generated with](/wiki/Monster_starting_inventory "Monster starting inventory") orcish chain mail;[\[3\]](#cite_note-3) [orc-captains](/wiki/Orc-captain "Orc-captain") have a 1⁄2 chance of being generated with Mordor orc armor, giving them an effective 1⁄6 chance of generating with orcish chain mail.[\[4\]](#cite_note-4)

## Description

While worn, orcish chain mail provides 4 base [AC](/wiki/AC "AC") and [MC1](/wiki/MC1 "MC1").

## Strategy

As with most [orcish](/wiki/Orcish "Orcish") items, orcish chain mail is less effective than standard chain mail, and [scale mail](/wiki/Scale_mail "Scale mail") offers the same base AC while weighing less. Orcish chain mail can still suffice as armor for roles that do not regularly cast, at least until better and lighter armor can be found.

## History

Orcish chain mail first appears in [NetHack 3.0.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.0.0 "NetHack 3.0.0").

## Variants

Some variants give orcs (including orcish player characters) an AC bonus for wearing orcish chain mail, making it as effective for orcs as regular chain mail worn by other races.

### SLASH'EM

In [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), orcish [Undead Slayers](/wiki/Undead_Slayer "Undead Slayer") that start with chain mail will receive orcish chain mail instead, using the existing racial substitution code.

[Upgrading](/wiki/Upgrading "Upgrading") orcish chain mail will produce regular chain mail, and vice versa.

### UnNetHack

In [UnNetHack](/wiki/UnNetHack "UnNetHack"), orcish chain mail grants +1 AC to orcish monsters that wear them, including orcish characters.

### dNethack

In [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack") and [notdNetHack](/wiki/NotdNetHack "NotdNetHack"), orcish chain mail grants 2 AC, 2 [DR](/wiki/DR "DR") and MC1 when worn, and its weight is reduced to 150 [aum](/wiki/Aum "Aum").

### EvilHack

In [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack"), orcish chain mail grants +1 AC to orcish monsters that wear them, including orcish characters.

Orcish chain mail can be created at a [forge](/wiki/Forge_\(dungeon_feature\) "Forge (dungeon feature)") by combining [ring mail](/wiki/Ring_mail "Ring mail") and an [orcish shield](/wiki/Orcish_shield "Orcish shield").

### Hack'EM

In [Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM"), orcish chain mail grants +1 AC to orcish monsters that wear them, including orcish characters.

In addition to EvilHack forging recipes, upgrading orcish chain mail will produce regular chain mail and vice versa, as in SLASH'EM.

## References

2. [↑](#cite_ref-2) [src/u\_init.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 221](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/u_init.c#L221)
3. [↑](#cite_ref-3) [src/makemon.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 402](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/makemon.c#L402): *armor and weapons for Mordor orcs*
4. [↑](#cite_ref-4) [src/makemon.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 400](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/makemon.c#L400): *switch for orc-captains*
